newfound_talents.description: This is a comprehensive glossary of all talents that can be learned from Masters throughout the world of Eryndor. These are no longer purchased with Advancement Points.

combat.name: Ambusher
combat.effect: You have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature you have surprised.

combat.name: Brawler
combat.effect: Your unarmed strikes now deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage instead of 1.

combat.name: Brute Force
combat.effect: You have Advantage on Might checks made to break or destroy objects.

combat.name: Coordinated Charge
combat.effect: When an ally moves into melee range of an enemy, you can use your Reaction to move up to 10 feet towards that same enemy.

combat.name: Follow Through
combat.effect: When you defeat an enemy with a melee attack, you may immediately use your movement action.

combat.name: Heavy Hitter
combat.effect: When you make an attack with a Heavy weapon, you can choose to take a -2 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you deal an additional +4 damage.

combat.name: Intimidating Presence
combat.effect: You can use your Might attribute instead of your Spirit attribute when making Diplomacy (Intimidation) checks.

combat.name: Lead from the Front
combat.effect: When you are the first to enter a combat zone, you gain a +2 bonus to your initiative roll.

combat.name: Opportunist
combat.effect: Once per round, you can make an Attack of Opportunity without expending your Reaction.

combat.name: Phalanx Fighter
combat.effect: When you are adjacent to an ally who also has this talent, you both gain a +1 bonus to your defensive rolls.

combat.name: Precise Strike
combat.effect: You can choose to forgo your movement action for the turn to gain Advantage on your next attack roll.

combat.name: Press the Advantage
combat.effect: If you hit a creature that is suffering from a negative status effect, you deal an additional +2 damage.

combat.name: Quick Reflexes
combat.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to all initiative rolls.

combat.name: Riposte
combat.effect: When an enemy misses you with a melee attack, you can use your Reaction to make one melee attack against them.

combat.name: Strategic Withdrawal
combat.effect: You can use your major action to allow all allies within 30 feet to use their Reaction to move up to half their movement speed away from an enemy.

combat.name: Warcry
combat.effect: As a major action, you can let out a fearsome cry. All enemies within 30 feet who can hear you must make a Spirit DC 14 check or become 'Frightened' for 1 round.

support.name: Battlefield Medic
support.effect: You can use your movement action to move towards a wounded ally without provoking attacks of opportunity.

support.name: Body Language Expert
support.effect: You have Advantage on checks made to determine if a creature is lying.

support.name: Coordinated Maneuver
support.effect: As a major action, grant one ally an immediate free movement action.

support.name: Demoralizing Taunt
support.effect: As a major action, you can force a single enemy to make a Spirit DC 14 check or have a -2 penalty on their next attack roll.

support.name: Guardian's Resilience
support.effect: When you are reduced to 0 Vitality, you can use your Reaction to remain at 1 Vitality instead. This can only be used once per day.

support.name: Healer's Touch
support.effect: You can use a major action to stabilize a creature that is Downed without needing to make a check.

support.name: Hold the Line
support.effect: Enemies you are in melee with cannot use the Disengage action to move away from you.

support.name: Inspiring Word
support.effect: As a bonus action, you can grant an ally within 30 feet 5 temporary Resolve. This can only be used on a creature once per combat.

support.name: Intercede
support.effect: When an enemy attacks an ally who is within 5 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to move between them and declare yourself the new target of the attack.

support.name: Medic
support.effect: When you use a Healing Salve on an ally, it restores an additional 1d6 Vitality.

support.name: Shield Master
support.effect: When you take the Defend action with a shield, you can add the shield's bonus to your defensive rolls against both physical and magical attacks for that round.

support.name: Stand Your Ground
support.effect: As a major action, you can grant an ally within 10 feet temporary Vitality equal to your Spirit attribute. This temporary Vitality lasts for 1 minute.

support.name: Tactician
support.effect: After you succeed on a Mind (Lore) check to identify a creature's weakness, you can grant one ally Advantage on their first attack roll against that creature.

support.name: Triage Expert
support.effect: As a bonus action, you can determine the exact Vitality of any creature you can see.

support.name: Warning Cry
support.effect: When you roll for Initiative, you can choose to take the last position in the turn order. If you do, you and all allies within 30 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to their first defensive roll of the combat.

utility.name: Animal Empathy
utility.effect: You have Advantage on Spirit checks made to calm, influence, or understand the intent of non-magical beasts.

utility.name: Appraiser
utility.effect: You can accurately determine the value of non-magical art objects and gemstones.

utility.name: Arcane Dabbler
utility.effect: You learn one minor magical cantrip (a simple, at-will spell that costs no Resolve, like creating a small light, a puff of wind, or a minor sound). The specific cantrip is determined with the GM.

utility.name: Arcanist's Insight
utility.effect: When you identify a magical item, you also learn one of its hidden properties, if it has any.

utility.name: Camouflage
utility.effect: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by natural foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

utility.name: Connections
utility.effect: Once per session, you can declare that you 'know a guy' in a settlement, allowing you to find a black market, a fence, or a source of information.

utility.name: Dungeon Delver
utility.effect: You have Advantage on Mind checks made to spot or disarm traps.

utility.name: Expert Haggler
utility.effect: You have Advantage on Spirit (Diplomacy) checks made to negotiate prices for goods and services.

utility.name: Forager
utility.effect: When you make a Mind (Survival) check to forage for food and water, you find twice as much as you normally would.

utility.name: Guerilla Tactics
utility.effect: You have Advantage on Stealth checks when you are in a natural environment (forest, jungle, mountains, etc.).

utility.name: Herbalist
utility.effect: You have Advantage on checks made to identify and gather medicinal plants.

utility.name: Historian
utility.effect: You have Advantage on Mind (Lore) checks related to the history of the world and the Shattering.

utility.name: Keen Eye
utility.effect: You have Advantage on checks made to find hidden doors or compartments.

utility.name: Linguist
utility.effect: You learn two additional languages of your choice.

utility.name: Lip Reader
utility.effect: You can understand spoken language by reading lips.

utility.name: Master of Disguise
utility.effect: You gain proficiency with the Disguise Kit.

utility.name: Poisoner's Kit Proficiency
utility.effect: You gain proficiency with the Poisoner's Kit, allowing you to craft basic poisons from natural ingredients during a long rest.

utility.name: Resourceful
utility.effect: Once per session, you can produce a common, non-magical item from your pack.

utility.name: Ritual Caster
utility.effect: You can cast a spell as a ritual, taking 10 minutes to cast it. If you do, it does not cost any Resolve.

utility.name: Scroll Savant
utility.effect: You have Advantage on checks made to cast a spell from a scroll.

utility.name: Spell Slinger
utility.effect: When you cast a spell that requires an attack roll, you gain a +1 bonus to that roll.

utility.name: Streetwise
utility.effect: You have Advantage on checks made to gather common rumors or navigate bustling city streets.

utility.name: Survivalist
utility.effect: You can go for twice as long without food or water before suffering exhaustion.

utility.name: Trap Expert
utility.effect: You gain proficiency with Thieves' Tools, but only for the purpose of disarming and creating traps.
